result.execSummary:
The defendant Carissa L. Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Carissa L. Drake was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carissa L. Drake is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Carissa L. Drake was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Carissa L. Drake was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Register with Sex Offender Registry Program

Participate in other counseling as recommended by agent
Pay all court ordered obligations, restitution, and fees
Obtain/maintain full time employment and/or education and/or combination as approved by agent

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carissa L. Drake in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Carissa L. Drake in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 1:35 pm  Alternative presentence filed.  State has corrections to alternative PSI.   Response by Atty Debord.  Court will make it 2011.  Additional correction made by court  Agreement.  Atty Debord presents letter to court.  Atty Debord has corrections page 2.  State PSI, page 2 correction.  State objects.  Statement by court.  Page 3 Arguments by counsel.  Pages 8, 15& 16 corrections.  Atty Laufenberg presents sentencing arguments.  State request Ct 3, 5 months, 112 days jail credit, completed.  Ct 1  12 yrs prison 7 yrs initial conf & 5 yrs extended supervision.  Victim Witness coordinator reads letter from victim KSP.  Letter sealed by court.  Sentencing arguments presented by Atty Debord.  Atty Debord agrees with State recommendations for count 3.  Requesting  2 yrs initial conf. 6 yrs extended supervision or withhold sentence, 10 yrs probation with conditional jail time.  R.D. presents statement to court.  M.D. presents statement to court.  T.J.  presents statement to court.  Brief rebuttal by Atty Debrod.  Def presents statement.  Recess by Court at 2:42 pm.  to reconvene at 3:10 pm     Reconvene at 3:19 pm  All parties present.  Felony convictions rights reviewed by court.  Comply with sex offender registration.  DNA sample ordered.  Court will order court cost and DNA  surcharge.  Def has posted $450.00 towards atty fees and this will be applied towards cost.  General comments by Court.  Sentence credit 112 days.  Court order 12 yr prison, 6 yr initial conf and 6 yrs extended supervision.  Not eligible for challenge or substance program.  Ct 3 5 mont jail, credit 112 days completed.  AODA   Post convictions rights.  No sentence credit on Ct 1.  Conditions of supervision outlined on page 16 of states PSI with AODA assessment.

Defendant Carissa L. Drake in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:10 a.m./Appearances given by State.  Jury returns.  Carissa Drake, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Def. Ex. 14 - debit card statement.  Def. Ex. 14 offered and received.  State asks Court take judicial notice of a weather report for Langlade County marked as St. Ex. 2.  No objection by Def.'s Atty.  St. Ex. 2 offered and received.  9:54 a.m./Jury taken to jury room.  Recess.  10:05 a.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Court puts sidebar on the record.  Def.'s Ex. 15 marked - Video and audio recording of B.W. interview of 3-15-15.  Jury returns.  Def.'s Ex. 15 played for jury.  Def.'s Ex. 15 offered and received.  10:26 a.m./Defense rests.  Rebuttal witness called by State.  J.M., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  St. Ex. 3 marked.  Copy of J.M.'s report.  10:34 a.m./Officer Kyle Rustick, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  C.H., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  10:42 a.m./State rests.  Court advises jury that all evidence is in.  Jury taken to jury room.  Court puts sidebar on the record.  St. Ex. 3 is not offered and is withdrawn by the State.  Jury instructions to be used put on the record.  Exhibits will not go into jury.  If jury asks, will decide at that time.  10:55 a.m./Recess.  11:17 a.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Discussion as to jury note given to Clerk of Court office.  Jury instruction discussion.  11:23 a.m./Jury returns.  Court instructs jurors.  11:38 a.m./Closing arguments by State.  12:03 p.m./Closing arguments by Def.'s Atty.  12:08 p.m./Rebuttal argument by State.  12:11 p.m./Court gives jurors instructions.  Court reads verdicts to jury.  Court gives jury final instructions.  12:16 p.m./Bailiffs sworn.  Alternates are drawn.  Jurors #792 and #469 are excused at this time.  Those names are to be placed in the court file.  12:19 p.m./Jury taken to jury room to deliberate.  Court gives bailiff jury instructions and verdicts for the jury.  Court puts sidebar on the record.  12:22 p.m./Recess.   Reconvene 1:43pm  Jurors have questions, reviewed with counsel.  Judge responds to one question on the note.  Requesting exhibits.  Def's  Ex # 1 though #7 and 10 through 13 will be premitted to jury.  Recess 1:45 pm  (2:26 pm Jury has another question, Court addresses)  Reconvene 3:19 pm  Verdict reached, all parties present.  Jury presents   Court has received verdicts.  Ct 1 Guilty verdict.  Ct 2 Not guilty verdict.  Ct 3 - Guilty verdict.  3 unsigned verdicts.  Jury polled by Judge.  All jurors agree to verdict.  Jurors excused.  State move for judgment on verdict.  Court will direct clerk to enter verdict.  Ct 2 dismissed by court.  State moves to revoke bond, pending sentencing.  Response by Atty Debord.  Additional arguments by State.  Court will grant state's request, bond revoked.  PSI requested.  DA presents statement to court, special prosecutor.  Sentencing date discussed.    Recess 3:38 pm  Reconvene 3:46 pm  Scheduling sentence hearing

Defendant Carissa L. Drake in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:12 a.m./Judge opens court and State gives appearances.  Court asks questions of jurors.  Juror #300 excused because not a Langlade County resident.  All prospective jurors sworn.  Voir dire begins.  Court advises jurors of case caption and charges.  9:45 a.m./Court moves into jury room to talk to specific jurors with public being invited.  Juror #517 questioned and struck for cause.  Juror #193 questioned and then sent back to courtroom.  Juror #476 explains situation to the Court and is excused.  9:55 a.m./Voir dire continues in courtroom.  10:37 a.m./All parties return to jury room.  Juror #193 explains position and struck for cause.  10:40 a.m./Voir dire continues in courtroom.  11:05 a.m./Jury selected and sworn.  Balance of jurors excused.  Jurors taken to jury room.  Recess.  11:30 a.m./All parties present.  Court goes back on the record.  Court puts sidebars on the record.  Parties accept jury instructions.  Jury returns.  Court explains process for alternates.  Court gives jurors preliminary instructions.  11:43 a.m./State makes opening statement.  11:50 a.m./Def.'s Atty. makes opening statement.  11:51 a.m./Court addresses the jury in regard to lunch and taking notes.  Jury taken to jury room.  Discussion as to correct witness initials and names.  Recess.  1:07 p.m./All parties present.  Jury returns.  State corrects initials and name used in opening statement.  R.M., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  1:14 p.m./J.S., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  1:22 p.m./Officer Kyle Rustick, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  1:34 p.m./K.P., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  1:48 p.m./Jury taken to jury room.  Recess.  2:06 p.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Jury returns.  M.J., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  2:21 p.m./Z.M., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Short recess.  Jury remains in courtroom.  Testimony of Z.M. continues.  2:30 p.m./State rests.  Jury taken to jury room.  Recess.  2:40 p.m./Reconvene.  All parties present.  Def.'s Atty. feels State has not met it's burden.  Response by State.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  Jury returns.  K.M., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Def.'s Ex. 1 through 7 - series of photographs of facebook.  Def.'s Ex. 1 through 7 offered and received.  R.B., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Def.'s Ex. 8 - Statement typed by R.B.  Def.'s Ex. 8 offered and received.  B.W., duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Def.'s Ex. 10 through 13 - series of photographs of facebook.  Def.'s Ex. 9 - Letter from B.W. to Def.  Def.'s Ex. 9, 10, 11, 12 and 13 offered and received.  St. Ex. 1 - Statement by B.W.  St. Ex. 1 read into record by D.A.  St. Ex. 1 offered and received.  3:49 p.m./Jury released.  To reconvene at 9:00 a.m.  Court instructs jury before leaving about discussing case and about listening/reading news.  Jury no longer present.  Court has colloquy with Def. in regarding to testifying.  Def. intends to testify.  Court finds Def.'s decision to testify is free and voluntary.  Def.'s Atty. makes record in regard to Def. testifying.  Court puts sidebars on the record.  Court has set of jury instructions and verdicts and gives copies to parties to review.  4:06 p.m./Recess.

Defendant Carissa L. Drake in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF42 and 15CM6.   Motions have been filed by Atty Debord.  Motion in Limine  # 1 is being withdrawn by Atty Debord.  3rd motion to consolidation of 2 cases.  No objection by State.  Court questions def in regards to hearing cases together.  Atty Debord has no objection to 15CM8 to be added as count 7 in 15CM42.  DA will be filing an information to include all counts.  Def understands.  #4 not relevant.  # 2 - Arguments by counsel.  Review of statements by victims.  Additional arguments.  Off record 2:02 pm.  Back on record 2:04 pm.  This motion held.  15CM6 State request case be dismissed and consolidated into 15CF42.  Amended Information received.  Wording changed on amended information.  No objection by Atty Debord.  Waive reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will dismiss 15CM6 without prejudice.  Additional motions filed in June.  # 1 Granted.  # 2 Statement by DA.  Granted.  # 3 Granted.  # 4 Granted.  # 5 - Statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Debord. Granted. # 6 - Granted # 7 - Granted.  #8 Granted.  # 9 At trial issue.  # 10 - Granted both ways.  # 11 - Statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Debord.  Additional statement.  Court will grant. Statement by DA in regards to def testifying.  Witness list to be provided to court.  Court addresses jurors taking notes and if jurors can ask questions.  No questions from jurors.   Additional statements by counsel.

No unsupervised contact with minors unless supervised by an adult. Can have supervised contact with daughter if somebody from Langlade County Department Social Services or Langlade County Juvenile Court present, & No discussion regarding this case.

Defendant Carissa L. Drake in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF42 & 15CM6  @ 2:00 pm. Judge Tlusty and CR appear by telephone from Lincoln Co. Victim rights have been complied with. Both parties agree with Judge Tlusty appearing from Lincoln Co.  State would agree no private or unsupervised contact with minors. Atty DeBord gives argument regarding victim.  State objects to any contact with victim.  Supervised visit by Social Services or Juvenile Court supervisor. Atty DeBord does not object.  Court will allow  modify bond, def can have no unsupervised contact with minors unless supervised by an adult. Can have supervised contact with daughter if somebody from Langlade Dept  Social Services or Langlade Co. Juvenile Court present, no discussion regarding this case.
Withdrawal of Speedy Trial Demand and Motion for Continuance
